ALL WELL AND GOOD.Definition: You say that something is all very well/fine/good if it seems good by itself but you think that there are problems connected with it

ALLEGEDLY.Definition: to say that someone has done something illegal or wrong without giving proof

AN IRON FIST.Definition: to control a group of people very firmly, having complete power over everything they do

AUTHORITARIAN.Definition: demanding that people obey completely and refusing to allow them freedom to act as they wish

BANISHED.Definition: to send someone away, especially from their country, and not allow them to come back

BREED.Definition: a particular type of animal or plant

BREEDER.Definition: someone who keeps animals for the purpose of producing young animals in a controlled way

CONSTITUTION.Definition: the set of political principles by which a state or organisation is governed, especially in relation to the rights of the people it governs

CULT OF PERSONALITY.Definition: a situation in which a public figure (such as a political leader) is deliberately presented to the people of a country as a great person who should be admired and loved

DESIGNATED.Definition: to choose someone officially to do a particular job

DOTING.Definition: showing that you love someone very much

DOWNRIGHT.Definition: (especially of something bad) extremely or very great

DRASTIC.Definition: (especially of actions) severe and sudden or having very noticeable effects

ECCENTRIC.Definition: strange or unusual, sometimes in a humorous way

HANDFUL.Definition: a small number of people or things

KNOCK-ON EFFECT.Definition: When an event or situation has a knock-on effect, it causes other events or situations, but not directly

LIP-SYNCHING.Definition: to move your lips at the same time as a recording is being played, in order to pretend that you are singing or saying the words

NEUTRAL.Definition: not saying or doing anything that would encourage or help any of the groups involved in an argument or war

NICKNAME.Definition: an informal name for someone or something, especially a name that you are called by your friends or family, usually based on your real name or your character

OPPRESSIVELY.Definition: in a cruel and unfair way that does not allow people the freedom they should have

PARADOX.Definition: a situation or statement that seems impossible or is difficult to understand because it contains two opposite facts or characteristics

PREDECESSOR.Definition: someone who had a job or a position before someone else, or something that comes before another thing in time or in a series

PROSPERITY.Definition: the state of being successful and having a lot of money

RALLY CAR.Definition: a car that has been specially designed or modified to be used in motor rallies

RUMOURS.Definition: an unofficial interesting story or piece of news that might be true or invented, and quickly spreads from person to person

SCRAMBLE.Definition: to compete with other people for something there is very little of

SUPREME.Definition: having the highest rank, level, or importance

TOPICAL.Definition: of interest at the present time; relating to things that are happening at present

WEALTH.Definition: a large amount of money or valuable possessions that someone has
